document_title: Capture the exact title of the DDP document as provided by the user. Ask for it if missing.
product_name: Use the product or system name described in the plan. If multiple appear, confirm the primary one.
version: Record the version or revision identifier (e.g., v1.2, Rev B). If absent, ask the user to supply it.
revision_date: Parse the most recent revision or approval date in ISO format (YYYY-MM-DD).
prepared_by: List each contributor with name, role, and organization if stated. Preserve the provided ordering.
purpose: Summarize why the DDP exists and the objectives it supports.
background: Provide concise context, history, or references that led to the current plan.
design_inputs: Create one entry per requirement. Map source citations (e.g., standards, user need IDs) to `source` and the corresponding statement to `requirement`. Include acceptance criteria when defined.
design_constraints: List explicit constraints (regulatory, technical, environmental). Each bullet becomes an item.
intended_use: Describe how the product is meant to be used, including patient/population and environment if available.
user_needs: Capture each user need or requirement as a separate array item using concise phrasing.
design_outputs: List resulting deliverables or specifications that satisfy inputs. Link to an input identifier when provided.
risks: For each hazard analysis row, populate hazard, harm, and mitigation. Map severity/probability words to the allowed enumerations.
verification_plan: For each verification activity, record the item under test, method, acceptance criteria, status, and due date if stated.
validation_plan: Capture each validation study or activity with its method, acceptance criteria, status, and due date when given.
milestones: Summarize major plan milestones with planned and actual dates when available. Use the provided status terms.
approvals: List the approvers in signing order including role, organization, and approval date if recorded.
notes: Include general notes or follow-up items that do not belong in other sections.
